fields.description:
This change is required for Studio.

The changes are:
* UnfilteredCrowdService interface has been moved from the embedded-crowd-core module to embedded-crowd-api module.
* The package name for UnfilteredCrowdService has changed from {{com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core}} to {{com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api}}.
* Delegated authentication directory now only adds the user to the auto-add groups on first successful authentication, instead of every successful authentication
    *- i.e. once the user is created locally, if an auto-add group is removed, the group will not be re-added after the next successful authentication
* Fix for [EMBCWD-830|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/EMBCWD-830] - NPE for auto-add groups on Oracle DB
fields.summary: Upgrade Crowd dependencies to Crowd 2.2.5 and EmbCwd 1.2.4

fields.description: When performing an advanced search filtering for the "create" field, it doesn't return the correct number of issues. For example, if we create an issue at '2011-04-04 12:02' and perform a search with the filter created <= 2011-04-04, the issue create at 12:02 is not returned. I believe the system, in this case, performs a search like created <= '2011-04-04 00:00'.
fields.summary: JQL Search not returning the correct results

fields.description:
When a CSV file is imported into a JIRA instance, the comments does not seem to be imported in proper order. In the screenshots below, the comments does not appear in correct order as it was created.

!JIRA_43_CSV_Import_Comments_Order.png!

However, the problem does not exist in JIRA 4.2.4:

!JIRA_424_CSV_Import_Comments_Order.png!

This problem seems to affect both JIRA 4.3 and 4.3.1. In JIRA 4.3, there was an option to download the latest version of the JIRA Importers Plugin (version 2.2.0), but the comments are still unordered.
fields.summary: JIRA Importers Plugin Causes Comments to be Imported in Random Order

fields.description:
we are coming from a bugzilla background and consider to switch to JIRA however the handling of attachments gives us some griefs:

- there is no real easy to navigate link between comment and attachment
- attachment seems to have NOT lifecycle (please, this is a must have)

will this be fixed/implemented in the near future ?
fields.summary: bugzilla like handling of attachment (links, comments, lifecycle)

fields.description:
in bugzilla you can have prodcuts with group rights.
i think the same applies for JIRA.

unfortunately currently the bugzilla importer does not obey the group rights.
As simple feature would be that 
- the correpsonding group gets created
- all users belonging to the group get assigned to the group
- the product gets assigned to the group
fields.summary: bugzilla importer does not obey group and rights

fields.description:
in bugzilla it is possible to have private comments, as it is in JIRA.
however currently the JIRA buzilla importer does not obey private comments during the import.

this is a bug in the importer which should be fixed
fields.summary: bugzilla importer does not obey private comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24242].
  {panel}

Due to a misconfiguration on the OS level, JIRA restarted.
At that moment it was re-indexing

When it came back up, most filters returned 0 results ...
This was resolved by running a reindex.


It would be an improvement to notify users/admin that a reindex operation 
was interrupted (for some reason)

Provide the option to remove the Comment field from the Logging Work window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24238].
  {panel}

The typical non-development task cycle at iDalko is as follows

* Put a task (a subtask of a story) 'in progress'
* Open the log window
* Start working on the task, keep track of activities in the log window
* At EOD/interrupt/task completion, enter the amount of time you have been working.
* Transition the task back to open or closed


We have to use the JIRA log work form to actually enter this information, 
because this form shows the time that the log work form has been opened
(start time)

It would be good if this could also be added to the greenhopper log window.
fields.summary: As a developer I can use the log work dialog box to measure time elapsed working on a task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24237].
  {panel}

It does happen that I change the fixversion of a parent issue - while editing.
When I come back to the greenhopper task board, the parent issue will have any subtasks listed
(because the fixversion of the subtasks are still on the old value).

It would be handy to have an action 'repair subtask fix version ...' or something like that, which would iterate over all unresolved subtasks and modify the fixversion of the subtasks to be the version of the parent.
fields.summary: As a user I can 'repair fixversion of subtasks' after I changed the fixversion of a parent issue through the JIRA interface
As a GH user I would like my parent label to be reflected in my sub-tasks once the parent is updated to ensure that they are in sync

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24232].
  {panel}

We currently use Atlassian's entire suite of products and one of the really nice features in Bamboo are global variables.  You can setup name:value pairs to be used in builds, etc.

In JIRA, we house multiple projects that follow the same release timeline.  Currently, we need to manually keep all of the versions in sync across projects.  There is already a JIRA ticket in place to address that (JRA-2698).

This ticket is nearly identical to the "Global Variables" request in Confluence (CONF-3999).  In our business, we setup a custom dashboard for each version of our software that keys on various filters (Unresolved, All, Released, Priority, etc.).  When we start on a new release, we have to go into each of the dozens of filters and manually change the fixVersion in the query.

If we had a simple way to declare a global variable (e.g. $currentFixVersion), we would no longer need to update all of the filters each time we had a release.
fields.summary: Global Variables

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
{quote}
1. Start JIRA
2. Create a new project
3. Create a new issue with qwert as a summary
4. Add a comment with text asdf
5. Execute this query with the same user who created the issue: comment ~ asdf
6. We can find the issue
7. Create a new restricted Security Scheme to reporter
8. Assign it to all issues in the project
9. Try to execute the query again. In this point we don't see this issue
10. Try execute this query: sumary ~ qwert
11. And now we can see the issue 
{quote}

* When you edit the security level assigned to the issue to include Current Assignee, same behavior happens, even if you are logged in with the current assignee user.
* When you edit the security level assigned to the issue to include Single User, or Project Lead, the search works as expected.
*  The bug affects all JIRA versions above 4.0 (including minor releases) 
* Kindly refer to the attached screen shots for demonstration.

Regards,
Ali
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Comment search returns empty result when issue security level is restricted to Reporter and/or Current Assignee even if the search performer (logged in user) is the Reporter (or Current Assignee)

fields.description:
In our particular case, we have the problem that sometimes Crowd goes down (planned or otherwise, doesn't matter why or how) and when this happens, JIRA stops creating tickets from incoming mail, instead forwarding all incoming mail to admins along with a stacktrace that starts like this:
{code}
com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: org.codehaus.xfire.XFireRuntimeException: Could not invoke service.. Nested exception is org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault: Could not execute JDBC batch update; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: Could not execute JDBC batch update
{code}

That's our case, but it happens with other errors as well: whenever an incoming mail can't be turned into a JIRA ticket, the mail just gets forwarded to the admin along with the error stacktrace, and then *JIRA just removes the mail from its queue*.

I think it'd be better if JIRA sent a warning about all this to the admin (instead of an error), so that the admin can check it out if it's actually something unexpected and/or persistent, but have JIRA also keep incoming mail in its queue to try again later - or maybe at least when the cause is Crowd or whatever other external service being down.

The admin may be able to fix the problem, but usually can't do much with the e-mails except recreating them all by hand in JIRA (or forwarding them back to JIRA, but then the reporter on those tickets comes up wrong...).

So, to summarize: is it possible to have JIRA keep incoming mail that can't be turned into tickets in its queue if the problem is caused by external services being down (or just all the time)?
fields.summary: Keep mail in queue & retry later when errors are encountered

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24223].
  {panel}

Hello Guys,

Configuring issue creation via email, and using the ccWatcher option to add cc's of the email as watchers of the issue, specifically when the issue is created, the users are added as watchers, but they aren't notified of the creation of the issue, if the group to be notified is the watchers group.

I'm not sure it the mail notification is fired before the users are added as watchers, but it's something to look at.

Cheers
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: ccWatcher does not notify users when issue is created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24222].
  {panel}

Our JIRA is connected to crowd for user ident/authentication. Crowd connects to our AD, where people are identified (login) by a badge number (like g123456).
In the Jira 'view members' page for a given project, if one wants to copy a list of name from one role to another this is not possible.
For example:
 John Doe = g01
 Brad Pitt = g02
 John Ford = g03
If I look at the 'Users' role members, I may have listed 'John Doe, Brad Pitt, John Ford'
But if I copy (ctrl+c) the list and try to add it to another role (say developers), Jira won't autocomplete the names with their badge numbers. (In fact it will do it only for the last name after the last ',') So we have to add users 1 by 1, which is not nice when we have many users to refer to.


(I have created support issue for this, told me to create an issue on jira: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-76789)
fields.summary: Cannot copy a list of user names in 'view project members' roles

fields.description:
Internal with LDAP Authentication does not have "copy user on first login option" like the one in Confluence as stated in this [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication#ConnectingtoanInternalDirectorywithLDAPAuthentication-UserSchemaSettings%28UsedwhenCopyingUsersonFirstLogin%29]. 

After setting up Internal with LDAP Authentication, JIRA internal users are not authenticated with LDAP and we still need to create all the "Delegated LDAP Directory" users manually in JIRA with "Delegated LDAP Directory" at the top of [User Directory|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+User+Directories]. 

This "copy user option" feature will be implemented in JIRA 4.3.3

*As a workaround*
Backup and modify the database for the tables {{cwd_membership}} and {{cwd_user}} so that the {{directory_id}} is set to be the id of "Delegated LDAP Directory" as in the table {{cwd_directory}}. This will make the internal users to be authenticated with LDAP.
fields.summary: Internal with LDAP Authentication does not have copy user on first login option

But no one in our company likes the new look and feel of the 4.3 version. Is there any possibilty to update but to stay with the old look of, for example, the issue screen? So basically to update the background and keep the old foreground?
fields.summary: Look And Feel of 4.0

fields.description:
1. Install a user plugin that overrides a system provided function (i.e. echo).
2. Notice the system function has not been overridden yet.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 10 April 2012|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hello All,

Many thanks for your feedback on this issue.

After following the thread here and also researching the related support tickets we've identified four main areas that can be broken down into two main paths:

1. Migrating whole directories:
1.1 Internal to Internal with Delegated Auth
1.2 Internal with Delegated Auth to Internal

and 

2. Migrating users from one directory to another:
2.1 Individually
2.2 All users in a directory

We have started working on a fix for 1.1 and 1.2 and we believe this will solve most the of the problems outlined in our research thus far. We hope to finish up this fix in the next few weeks and release it in 5.0.x.

We'll continue to update this issue as more information comes to hand.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Management
{panel}
\\

Once a user created in 1 directory, there is no way to migrate the user to other directory. For example, migrate the user from Internal Directory to internal directory with LDAP Authentication (LDAP Delegated Authentication).
fields.summary: Not able to migrate user from 1 directory to another directory

fields.description:
As according to the [4.3 Upgrade Guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.3+Upgrade+Guide#JIRA4.3UpgradeGuide-ChangestousermanagementinJIRA], if the customer previously connects JIRA to an LDAP for authentication, the customer have to move the existing {{osuser.xml}} file to the {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes}} during upgrade before firing up JIRA 4.3 for the first time in order to import the existing LDAP server configuration. However, after the configuration import is performed successfully, it is not possible to reconfigure the imported LDAP configuration again, which is troublesome in case the customer decided to change the LDAP server to other IP. 

!scshot1.png!
fields.summary: Cannot Reconfigure the Imported LDAP Configuration After Upgrade

fields.description:
We introduced a change in JIRA 4.2 that causes the getText() method (responsible for looking up i18nsations) to retrieve all columns *every* single time.  If you have an instance with a lot of custom fields that means a ton of permission checks for every single time we lookup i18n keys.

We should cache the results of retrieving the list of columns a user can add.
fields.summary: Performance issues when configuring issue navigator columns with lots of custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24204].
  {panel}

Hello,

I notice that a lot of users want to know what kind of jira project theý're having on there hands.

What kind of permissions does it have? What kind of notification scheme is being used? Which workflow scheme is it using? Which users have what set of project roles?

Currently there's no way for a user to see this kind of information (at least I can't find anything in jira.atlassian.com, neither in 3.13.5 I am using.).

The only ones who can see this information are jira-(system)-administrators.

It would be great is users could see this information. Currently what happens is one of the following:

- Users come to me and ask me to explain (over and over again)
- I might buy confluence and explain everything in some confluence space/page.
- People are confused about the projects settings and stop to care about them, leaving issues in incorrect states, etc. ("Don't make me think", Steve Krug)

By adding an extra tab to the browse project page could help out a lot!

A nice example of a similar solution, but for workflow conditions is the [Conditions Validator plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/39261]
fields.summary: Show information about a project's schemes to the user (permission scheme, notification scheme, workflow scheme, etc ...)

Link rendering has been tested between JIRA and applications as follows:

|| ||  || Working? ||
| JIRA 4.3 | FECRU 2.5 | (x) |
| JIRA 4.3 | FECRU 2.4 | (x) |
| JIRA 4.3 | Confluence 3.5 | (x) |
| JIRA 4.1.2 (applinks version 2.1.2) | FECRU 2.3 | (/) |
| JIRA 4.1.2 (applinks version 2.1.2) | FECRU 2.5 | (/) |

* In conclusion, link rendering never worked in JIRA 4.3, as it is supposed to (see [this|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Link+Rendering] documentation).
* The application linkings with 4.3 were done via Oauth, Basic Auth. as well as Trusted Apps. All seem to work fine 
* Each application was tested at once (at a time, JIRA was configured with one application, so there is no duplicate server IDs).
* Wiki Style rendering is enabled
* Observation is that JIRA 4.3 does not even try to connect to the remote application when link rendering is attempted, whereas *it used to work in previous versions of applinks plugin.*

Below are two examples (both with same configurations attempt). I just typed "CR-TEST-1" and here is the result after clicking on "add":
{color:green} Working {color}
!working.png!

{color:red} Not Working {color}
!not working.PNG!

Thanks
Ali
Atlassian Support

fields.description:
JIRA has an old version of JSONObject included in com.atlassian.jira.util.json. The constructor that takes a "bean" as parameter will try to use reflection to turn the passed object graph into JSON.

This functionality is broken in the current version:

[line 312] method.invoke(bean, (Object) null)

method.invoke takes a varargs argument (since Java 1.5?), but will be invoked on a zero-argument getter, which will thrown an Exception that is then silently swallowed, resulting in an empty JSON string for a valid model.

The current version of JSONObject (https://github.com/douglascrockford/JSON-java/blob/master/JSONObject.java) correctly passes in an Object[].
Suggesting to turn it into a dependency lib instead of incorporating it into JIRA as well.
fields.summary: The version of JSONObject shipped with JIRA is not compatible to current Java versions

fields.description:
A user from my company wants me to file this bug

** Steps To Reproduce:
1) attempt to attach
2) browse to a file which is too big, in my case, a deb.

** Expected Result:

Either

a) the file should be attached

or

b) the file should not be attached and the field should be empty

** Actual Result:

the field is filled with the "too big" file name and there's no way to clear it. Attempts to edit that field are treated as though you had hit the "browse" button. command-A will select the field's contents, but neither <del> nor <backspace> will delete it. Your only recourse is to "cancel" and start over which is a nuisance if you've already listed some number of other files.
fields.summary: jira gets hosed when attempting to attach

fields.summary: JQL Statement using combination of WAS and BEFORE and AFTER keywords results in NullPointerException

fields.description:
Fuzzy search able find a part at the beginning but not at the end of a word.
For example:

bq. project=jira and summary ~ estim

Query above are able to return 129 issue ( at the time of creating this report) contain "estimates". 
Click [here to view result|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=project%3Djira+and+summary+~+estim]


However if we use query with "mates" instead of "estim":

bq. project=jira and summary ~ mates

It will return 0 result.
Click [here to view result|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=project%3Djira+and+summary+~+mates].

This brings some trouble while searching keyword like PROJECT-UTS124-ANDROID where user only remember keyword of ANDROID.
fields.summary: Fuzzy search feature not able to search word's end phrase

fields.description: When you delete a directory (cwd_directory table), the users that were part of that directory (cwd_user table), the groups (cwd_group table) and the associations between users and groups (cwd_membership table) are not deleted, leaving several rows on the database, which can be confusing.
fields.summary: Deleting a directory does not delete the rows in other tables related to it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24173].
  {panel}

As a user printing filter results, I want the printed page to be easily readable, so I can have a record of the work at the beginning and end of the sprint for evaluating unplanned work and other issues, and so I can easily share information with non-Jira users.

We recently upgraded from 4.1.1 to 4.3.  During this transition, the filter results have been redesigned. Now, when you choose the "Printable" view, it is pretty near unusable, because of the formatting. (I was using Firefos 3.6.15 or 16)

- Columns are not appropriate widths
- There is no delineation between rows or columns, making it very difficult to read.

I ended up just using the excel version, but that adds extra steps to the process, and we're moving away from Office soon.
fields.summary: Printable view of filter results looks bad

at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.runUpgradeTasks(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:482)
...
{noformat}

h3. Cause

There is a user group missing "name" field in JIRA, which breaks group migration to JIRA 4.3+ version.

h3. Resolution

   1. Back up JIRA data
   2. Shutdown JIRA instance
   3. Run the below script in JIRA database
{code}
      update groupbase set groupname='DATA-FIX' where groupname is null
{code}
   4. Reboot JIRA instance
   5. If upgrade is successful, find 'DATA-FIX' group in JIRA, delete or rename it.
fields.summary: JIRA Upgrade Fails with "NullPointerException"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24171].
  {panel}

It seems currently, _LF_ (or Line Feed) code is used for new line in JIRA's notification e-mail (in text format).

Because of this, on some e-mail clients specifically designed for Windows, the content of e-mail look funny, as _LF_ is not recognized.

* Windows OS uses _CR+LF_ (or Carriage return plus Line Feed) for new line

It would be great if an administrator of JIRA could control which code should be used for the body content of notification e-mails.

We have asked Atlassian support about this but got a reply that probably modifying source code is required, as the vm files for notification mails don't define this part.

Regards,
JP Support
fields.summary: Provide a feature to control new line code used in JIRA's notification e-mail

fields.description:
If you already have an instance of 4.2.x or less running and start up 4.3 against the same jira.home it will not detect the home is locked as it relies on an OS lock on the lock file not just the file to exist.

In detail, Prior to 4.3 jira checks if the home directory for jira is locked or not by checking for the existence of the .jira-home.lock. After 4.3 we dont lock jira if the file exists but more if the file has an operating system lock on it. This means its possible to get 4.3 to start in the same jira home directory as a prior version that is already running.

So less than 4.3 and less than 4.3 works as before (the second instance will lock).
4.3 or greater and 4.3 or greater works as before (the second instance will lock).
4.3 or greater started first and less than 4.3 started second works as before (the second instance will lock).
BUT less than 4.3 started first then 4.3 or greater started will not lock the second instance.
fields.summary: Jira new way of locking jira.home is not backwards compatible.

fields.description:
After upgrade to JIRA 4.3, the option "More actions -> Attach Screenshot" still appearing and apparently working. However, after the attachment procedure is finished, the screenshoot is not saved. There're no specific error on the logs, but sometimes this message is logged:

{code}2011-03-23 14:13:03,103 TP-Processor6 anonymous 853x1140x1 - 10.0.2.245 /secure/applet/screenshot.jar HttpSession created [1kuc3um]

2011-03-23 14:13:25,511 TP-Processor3 anonymous 853x1142x1 10l0xkl 10.0.2.245 /secure/views/issue/screenshot-redirecter.jsp HttpSession [10l0xkl] destroyed for 'anonymous'

2011-03-23 14:13:25,511 TP-Processor3 anonymous 853x1142x1 10l0xkl 10.0.2.245 /secure/views/issue/screenshot-redirecter.jsp HttpSession created [cx2c94]

2011-03-23 14:13:25,592 TP-Processor3 mschroeder 853x1142x1 10l0xkl 10.0.2.245 /secure/views/issue/screenshot-redirecter.jsp The user 'test' has PASSED authentication.{code}

This behavior happens *ONLY* in the 4.3 version.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create an issue.
# Click on "More Actions" -> "Attach Screenshot"
# Attach a screenshoot and realize that no new file has been attached to the ticket.

It happens in all browsers able to use that option. Tested on IE8.
fields.summary: Cannot Attach a Screenshot After Upgrade to JIRA 4.3

Avoid replicating entire LDAP/AD identity directories into JIRA local database

fields.description:
We have delegated authentication to two LDAP repositories defined in our osuser.xml. Both LDAP directories hold unique users. When we try to upgrade we get error like in this [forum post|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=52447]: {code} ERROR [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Errors during Upgrade Task: Migrate User Directory configuration ERROR [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Errors occurred during upgrade: ERROR [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Upgrade Error: JIRA is unable to migrate the User Directory configuration because the osuser.xml file does not contain a recognized configuration.
Please see the Upgrade Guide for details. {code} If we remove the other one the upgrade works but of course creates only one delegated authentication directory. The configuration for LDAP is really simple and almost identical for both directories (only tree names and servers differ), here's sample of the other: {code} com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory ldap://my-server-name:389 OU=Users,OU=Company,DC=COM sAMAccountName user-to-use password-to-use true {code} Is it a good workaround to upgrade without osuser.xml and manually create directories? Documentation states that this will leave internal directory with users but is this a problem? As a side note, there are many upgrade tasks that require indexing and they give errors about custom user field indexing: {code} Issue PROJ-6800 has an invalid value 'jdoe' stored in the field 'Tester'. User 'jdoe' was not found in the system. {code} After crowd migration is done the users are found. Due to all indexing upgrade is really slow (much slower than with 4.2) and the indexing should only be done at the end?
fields.summary: osuser.xml migration fails if multiple ldap repositories defined

fields.description: I configured my JIRA instance to make Fix Version a required field. However I can still create issues without a Fix Version by sending email to my JIRA instance. I am using the Create or Comment Handler.

fields.description:
When Confluence is connected to JIRA, users in any directories defined after the JIRA directory will fail to authenticate.

One workaround is to make JIRA the last directory in Confluence, so that all other directories get a chance to authenticate before it.

The bug is caused by [CWD-2276|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-2276] and will be fixed by JIRA embedding a version of Crowd that's 2.2.1 or later.
fields.summary: When Confluence is connected to JIRA, users in directories defined after the JIRA directory will fail to authenticate

fields.description:
When JIRA is connected to Crowd, and Crowd has a delegated authentication directory defined in the list of directories for the JIRA app, authentication does not work for users that aren't manually created in the delegated authentication directory.

This is because Seraph attempts to find the user in the directory before authenticating - and the delegated authentication directory attempts to create the user only upon successful authentication.

The fix will be in Seraph: [SER-166]

JIRA will need to upgrade to Seraph 2.5.0 when released.
fields.summary: JIRA connected to Crowd with a delegated authentication directory will not correctly authenticate users

fields.description:
When creating a project, we are able to search for the project lead we wish to set by typing the name of the user or the username. It's important to keep in mind that JIRA does not support username in uppercase and that default assignee of the project is set as the project lead.

For example, the instance has a username 'admin' named as 'Administrator'. If in the project lead field we type 'Admin' and continue to fill others fields for the project which is being created, without clicking on the search result suggest by JIRA and click in the 'Create' button, the default assignee will be the user 'Admin' instead of 'admin'. We can check it by laying the mouse icon on the project lead user link.
fields.summary: Project Lead User set incorrectly

fields.description:
The description for the Schedule Issues permission is: 

Schedule Issues 
Ability to set or edit an issue's due date.

It also controls whether the due date field is shown or not show. "Set" and "edit" seem synonymous in this context. I would suggest something along the lines of

"Ability to view or edit an issue's due date"
fields.summary: Misleading description of Schedule Issues permission

fields.description: With the release of JIRA 4.3, users can now specify a fix or affects version with a wildcard symbol in the Quick Search box (eg ff:4.*). Would be great to have the same functionality in JQL.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24150].
  {panel}

A complete description appears in the attached support request.

I would like to access historical remaining estimates via the REST API. It seems most natural to me to add a "timeestimate" field to the "worklog" object, so that every worklog object indicates what the corresponding estimated time remaining was.

Alternatively, a timestamped sequence of remaining estimate objects would work for me.

I intend to use the information to compute the accuracy of every estimate, without treating "original estimates" as a special case.

See also JRA-14538, which is a similar request. My request is specific to the REST API whereas JRA-14538 requests access to the information more generally.
fields.summary: Provide REST API access to historical remaining estimates.

When typing within the designer (i.e. typing a transition name) the shortcuts are enabled. For example if you try to type 'c' the create an issue pops up. I guess the shortcuts needs to be disabled while the designer is on.

This might be a browser issue. I couldn't reproduce when using Mozilla Firefox 3.6.15.
When using IE8 and Chrome the bug happens.

fields.description:
Hi,

currently it is only possible to add single URL fields to an issue type as documented in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+a+Custom+Field

In some circumstances, there are different URLs which are related to the issue. Pre-definition of "URL1", URL2, URL3 to to catch this is not useful.

Therefor a new field Type "multi URL Fields" might be useful which can be filled / added dynamically as like subtasks but also have the URL validation.

Perhaps it might also be useful to implement an automatism, which greps all links posted in the comments below and will show them up on top in a "URLs" section as like "issue links" and "Subtasks"

With kind regards,
~Marcel Silberhorn
fields.summary: Multi URL Field wanted AND / OR issue URLs overview

The atlassian-jira.log file only contains the stack trace ([500ErrorPage.jsp] Exception caught in 500 page Could not find workflow status for issu
e VUGIS-634) and stack traces from IssueMailQueueItem.send failure with the same cause.


Moreover, if I use new transitions to move an pre-existing issue (before workflow scheme migration) to "Validated", that issue has the same trouble too.

I got the same trouble on my test system and then on my productive system, I have applied exactly the same process, except I have imported the workflow from XML into productive system.

As the issue navigator does not display the new status (see Selection_019.png), I have tested a basic "re-index" on issues without success.

Integrity Checker does not detect any trouble, see Selection_020.png.

Database content seems perfectly correct, my issuestatus "Validated" has id 10008;
I have used queries from http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Issue+status+and+workflow :

{noformat}
mysql> select issuestatus from jiraissue where pkey='VUGIS-634';
+-------------+
| issuestatus |
+-------------+
| 10008       | 
+-------------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

mysql> select pname from issuestatus, jiraissue where issuestatus.id=jiraissue.issuestatus and pkey='VUGIS-634';
+-----------+
| pname     |
+-----------+
| Validated | 
+-----------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

mysql> select * from OS_WFENTRY where ID=(select workflow_id from jiraissue where pkey='VUGIS-634');
+-------+--------------------------------------+-------------+-------+
| ID    | NAME                                 | INITIALIZED | STATE |
+-------+--------------------------------------+-------------+-------+
| 50392 | Standard 3 with validation v1.1      |        NULL |     1 | 
+-------+--------------------------------------+-------------+-------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

mysql> select * from OS_CURRENTSTEP where ENTRY_ID=(select workflow_id from jiraissue where pkey='VUGIS-634');
+--------+----------+---------+-----------+-------+---------------------+----------+-------------+-----------+--------+
| ID     | ENTRY_ID | STEP_ID | ACTION_ID | OWNER | START_DATE          | DUE_DATE | FINISH_DATE | STATUS    | CALLER |
+--------+----------+---------+-----------+-------+---------------------+----------+-------------+-----------+--------+
| 158276 |    50392 |      10 |         0 |       | 2011-03-22 18:50:44 | NULL     | NULL        | Validated | NULL   | 
+--------+----------+---------+-----------+-------+---------------------+----------+-------------+-----------+--------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)
{noformat}

I have found the following workaround:
# Shutdown JIRA
# Startup JIRA, now the issue is displayed properly (no longer Oops System Error) but Issue Navigator still reports an empty status
# re-index to fix the Issue Navigator display

My guess: the "workflow permission" cache has not been invalidated after the workflow scheme migration and this trouble raised when a new status is added.
fields.summary: After workflow scheme migration, issue moved to a newly added status are not readable
Upgrade to JIM 2.1

fields.description:
When plugin A provides a module type and another plugin B consumes that module type, if plugin A is upgraded, B may or may not come up properly.  

This issues were first raised in:
https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-716
https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-717

This bug is impacts all plugins that provide module types including Speakeasy, Activity Streams, Active Objects, and ALM.  It needs to be fixed for Speakeasy's release in Codegeist.
fields.summary: When upgrading plugins that provide plugin points, the clients don't come up properly

fields.description: Based on comments on JRA-23955, the logs don't always show ERROR or WARNINGS when an {{UnknownHostException}} is thrown due to misconfigured DNS.
fields.summary: Improve logging when Active Directory DNS is misconfigured and referrals can't be followed
